snippet: Short-term unemployment has fallen to its prerecession level, but long-term unemployment remains more than twice as high as it was in 2007.
abstract: Long-term unemployment remains a persistent problem for millions of Americans, affecting twice as many people as it did in 2007, even as short-term unemployment has fallen to pre-recession level; little federal help exists for long-term jobless, but Obama administration is attempting to roll out career training programs and an initiative to urge businesses not to discriminate against these potential workers.
lead_paragraph: Short-term unemployment has fallen to its prerecession level, but long-term unemployment remains more than twice as high as it was in 2007.

headline.main: Out of Work, Out of Benefits, and Running Out of Options
headline.print_headline: Long Out of Work, and Running Out of Options
